quizData.question: A website with 6 <p> elements is created. Create CSS code that will layout the elements into 3 columns and 2 rows in the screen where all 3 columns take 30% of the entire screen.

A website with 4 <article> elements is created. Create CSS code that will layout the elements into 2 columns and 2 rows in the screen where the first column takes 68% of the screen while the second takes 28% and where the gap between rows is 20px and the gap between columns is 15px.
quizData.answer:
div {
display: grid;
grid-template-columns: 68% 28%;
row-gap: 20px;
column-gap: 15px;
}
choices:
div {
display: grid;
grid-template-columns: 68% 28%;
row-gap: 20px;
column-gap: 15px;
}

div {
display: grid;
grid-template-columns: 28% 68%;
grid-template-row-gap: 20px;
grid-template-column-gap: 15px;
}

div {
display: grid;
grid-template-columns:50% 50%;
grid-template-row-gap: 20px;
grid-template-column-gap: 15px;
}

div {
display: flex;
grid-template-columns: 68% 28%;
row-gap: 20px;
column-gap: 15px;
}

quizData.question: A website with 10 <div> elements is created. Create CSS code that will layout the elements into 2 columns and 5 rows in the screen where both columns take equal spaces of the available width and all the rows are 20px.

A website with 20 <div> elements is created. Create CSS code that will layout the elements into 2 columns and 10 rows in the screen where both columns take equal spaces of the available width and the rows alternate between 100px and 25px.
choices: Kunin mo na ang lahat sa akin, wag lang ang CSS ko
